div.head: ACT I

stage.stage: SCENE : A Hall of Judgment in the palace of Saul at Gibeah . The walls , pillars and ceiling are of cedar richly carven with images of serpents , pomegranates and cherubim in gold . The floors are of bright marble ; the throne of ivory , hung with a lion ’ s skin whose head is its footstool . On the right and left , doors , draped with finely woven curtains of purple and white , lead to other portions of the palace . Seats toward the front . Lamps burn low .

The Hall , supported on pillars , is open along the back , where a Porch , surrounding the Court of the palace , crosses . Through the Porch , on the environing hills , glow the camp-fires of the Philistines , the enemies of Israel .
JUDITH , LEAH and ZILLA are reclining restively on the floor of the Hall .

lg.l: O for a feast ! pomegranate wine and song !

sp.speaker: ZILLA
sp.p: A feast indeed ! the men in camp ! When was a laugh or any leaping here ? Never ; and none to charm with timbreling !

div.stage: She goes to the porch .

lg.l: Or till a youth wed Zilla for her beauty ?
I ’ ll not soil mine with sullen fear all day
Because these Philistines press round . As well
Be wenches gathering grapes or wool ! Come , Leah .

div.stage: She prepares to dance .

lg.l: No , Judith , I ’ ll put henna on my nails ,
And mend my anklet .

div.stage: She sits down .

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: Now hear her ! Who , who , now ? who , who is it ? dog , fox , devil ?

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: Then ’ tis Ishui !Bounding to curtains .Yes , Ishui ! And fury in him , sallow , sour fury ! A jackal were his mate ! Come , come , we ’ ll plague him .

sp.speaker: ZILLA
sp.p: And too — with David whom he hates !

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: Aie , David ! A joy to rouse men up to jealousy !

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: Hush , hush , be meet and ready now ; he ’ s near . Look as for silly visions and for dreams !

div.stage: They pose themselves . Ishui enters — sees them . Judith sighs .

lg.l: O ! ’ tis
Prince Ishui !
Prince Ishui ! Then he
Will tell us ! he will tell us !
Of David !
O is he come ! when , where , quick , quick , and will
He pluck us ecstasies out of his harp ,
Winning until we ’ re wanton for him , mad ,
And sigh and laugh and weep to the moon !

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: Low thing ! Chaff of the king !

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: The king ! I had not thought ! David a king ! how beauteous would he be !

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: Turban of sapphire ! robe of gold !

lg.l: Who , who can tell !
Have you not heard ? Yesterday in the camp
Among war-old but fearful men he offered
Kingly to meet Goliath — great Goliath !

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: What do you say ? to meet Goliath ?

div.stage: He thrusts her from him . She goes dancing with Zilla and Leah .

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: Who has entered .Ishui , in a rage ?

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: Not ?Deftly .You say well . I should not , no . Pardon , then , Adriel .

lg.l: Turn from it .— I have not
Bidden you here for vapours ; yet they had
Substance as well for you !
Who likes
Laughter against him !
Why ,
It is this shepherd !
With his harp !
Flinging enchantment on the palace air
Till he impassions to him all who breathe .

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: What sting from that ? He ’ s lovable and brave .

lg.l: This then : you ’ ve hither come with gifts and gold ,
Dream-bringing amethyst and weft of Ind ,
To wed my sister , Merab ?

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: And you ’ ve the king ’ s consent ; but she denies ?

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: As every wind , you know it .

lg.l: Still denies !
And you , lost in the maze of her , fare on
Blindly and find no reason for it !
How ?
What reason can be ? women are not clear ;
And least unto themselves .
Or to their fools .
lg.stage: He goes to curtains and draws out Adah .
lg.l: Your mistress , Merab , girl , whom does she love ?
Unclench your hands .

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: Insolent ! Answer ; I am not milky Jonathan . Answer ; and for the rest — You hear ?

lg.l: She loves —
The shepherd David !
I care not !
She is unkind ; I wilt not spy for her
On Michal , and I ’ ll tell her secrets all !
And David does not love her — and she raves .

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: Off to your sleep ; now off —

div.stage: Makes to strikes her .
ADAH goes .

lg.l: And see you now how ‘ lovable ’ he is !
I tell you that he stands athwart us all !
The heart of Merab swung a censer to him ,
My seat at table with the king usurped !
Mildew and mocking to the harp of Doeg ,
As it were any slave ’ s ; the while we all
Are lepered with suspicion .

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: Ah ! and of Jonathan and Michal .

lg.l: Hush .
Michal , delay . Whom lead you ?
Miriam ,
A prophetess .
He ’ s not at rest ; dreads Samuel ’ s prophecy
The throne shall pass from him , and darkens more
Against this boundless Philistine Goliath
Who dares at Israel daily on the hills ,
As we were dogs !
No ;
But he is sent for — and will ease him — Ah !
He ’ s wonderful to heal the king with his harp !
A waft , a sunny leap of melody ,
And swift the hovering mad shadow ’ s gone —
As magic !
Disdaining Doeg and his plea to dust ,
His waiting and the winning-o ’ er of Edom ,
You are enamoured of this David too ?

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: I think my brother Ishui hath a fever .

div.stage: She goes — calmly , with Miriam .

lg.l: Now are you kindled — are you quivering ,
Or must this shepherd put upon us more ?

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: But has he not dealt honorably ?

lg.l: Why have senses . He
With Samuel the prophet fast enshrouds
Some secret , and has Samuel not told
The kingdom from my father shall be rent
And fall unto another ?

div.stage: Voices are heard in altercation .

sp.speaker: And Samuel
sp.p: With prophecy or some refusal tears him !

div.stage: They step aside . SAUL followed by SAMUEL strides in and mounts the throne .

lg.l: You threat , and ever thunder threatening !
Pour seething prophesy into my veins ,
Till a simoon of madness in me moves .
Am I not king , the king ? chosen and sealed ?
Who ’ ve been anathema and have been bane
Unto the foes of Israel , and filled
The earth with death of them ?
And do you still forbid that I bear gold
And bribe away this Philistine array
Folded about us , fettering with flame ?
Yes ,— yes ! While there is air , and awe of Heaven
Do I forbid ! A champion must rise
To level this Goliath . Thus may we
Loose on them pest of panic and of fear .
Are forty days not dead ? A champion !
None will arise —’ tis vain . And I ’ ll not wait
On miracle .
Offer thy daughter then ,
Michal , thy fairest , to whoever shall .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Demand and drain for more ! without an end . Ever vexation ! No ; I will not .

lg.l: Then ,
Out of Jehovah and a vast foreseen
I tell thee again , thou perilous proud king ,
The sceptre shall slip from thee to another !

div.stage: He moves to go .

lg.l: From me ! No !
You rouse afar the billowing of ill .
I grant — go not !— I grovel to your will ,
Fear it and fawn as to omnipotence ,
And vow to all its divination — all !
Then , Saul of Israel , the hour is near ,
When shall arise one , and Goliath fall !

div.stage: SAMUEL goes slowly out , SAUL sinks back .

lg.l: Subtle !— subtle !
And yet I must not speak ; come , Adriel ,
No use of us here .

div.stage: He makes as if to go .

lg.l: Do not ask .…
Yet how it creeps , and how !
Do you not see it crawl , this serpent scheme ?
Goliath slain — the people mad with praise ,
Then fallen from you — Michal the victor ’ s wife .…
Or else the champion slain —
Fear on the people — panic — the kingdom ’ s ruin !

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Now do the folds slip from me .

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: And you see ? Ah then , if one arise ? If one arise ?

lg.l: Death , death ! If he hath touched this prophet — if
Merely a little moment !—
I have seen
Your David with him .
The folds slip further ;
To this you lead me — hatred against David !
To this with supple envy ’ s easy glide !
You have but builded lies ,
As ever you are building and forever .
I ’ ll hear no more against him — Abner — No .
David , and with his harp .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Not come ? He is not come ? And never ! but delays .

lg.l: There is not — Am I king ?
See you , ’ tis he ! ’ Tis David , and he sings !
DAVID
Smiter of hosts ,
Terrible Saul !
Vile on the hills shall he laugh who boasts
None is among
Great Israel ’ s all
Fearless for Saul , king Saul !
lg.stage: Entering with people of the palace .
lg.l: Aye , is there none
Galled of the sting ,
Will at the soul of Goliath run ?
Wring it and up
To his false gods fling ?…
None for the king , the king ?
lg.stage: He drops to his knee , amid praise , before the throne .
lg.l: SAUL
Forego this praise and stand
Away from him ; ’ tis overmuch .
Why have
You dallied and delayed ?
Why , my lord ,
I do not mock . Only the birds have wings .
Yet on the vales behind me I have left
Haste and a swirling wonderment of air ,
And in the torrent ’ s troubled vein amaze ,
So swift I hurried hither at your urgence
Out of the fields and folding the far sheep !

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: You have not ; you have dallied .He motions . All go but DAVID , whom he comes down toward , indeterminately .You have dallied .

lg.l: Deep in the king I see a darkness foam
And sheeted passion , as a lightning gust .
Shall I not play to him ?
You shall not , no .
I ’ ll not be lulled .
Is it a tiger gleam ,
Terrible fury stealing from the heart
And crouching cold within the eye of Saul ?

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I ’ ll not endure . They say that you —

lg.l: They say ?
What is this ravage in you . Does the truth
So limpid overflow in palaces ?
Never an enemy to venom it ?
Am I not David , faithful , and thy friend ?

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I ’ ll slay you , and regretless . DAVIDUnmoving

lg.l: SAUL
Do you not fear ? and brave me to my breast !
Have I done wrong that I should fear the king ?
Reed as I am , could he not breathe and break ?
And I should be oblivion at a word !
But under the terror of his might have I
Not seen his heart beat justice and beat love ?
See , even now …!

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I will not listen to them !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: To whom , my lord , and what ?

lg.l: Ever they say ,
“ This David ,” and “ this David !”

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: But think you , David , I shall lose the kingdom ? DAVIDStarting

lg.l: SAUL
Pain in your eyes ? you think it ? Deem
I cannot overleap this destiny ?
To that let us not verge ; it has but ill .
Deeper the future gulf is for our fears .
Forget it . Forget the brink may ever gape ,
And wield the throne so well that God himself
Must not unking you , more than he would cry
The morning star from Heaven ! Then , I swear it ,
None else will !
But words ,
Foolishly from the heart ; a shepherd speech !
Give them no mood ; but see , see yonder fires
Camping upon the peace of Israel ,
As we were carrion beneath the sun !
Let us conceive annihilation on them ,
Hurricane rush and deluging and ruin .
Ah , but the prophecy ! the prophecy !
It eats in me the food of rest and ease .
And David , nearer : Samuel in my stead
Another hath anointed .
Saul , not this !
This should not fall to me , my lord ; no more !
You cannot understand ; it pains beyond
All duty and enduring !

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Pains beyond …? Who is he ? know you of him ? do you ? know you ? You sup the confidence of Samuel ? I ’ ll search from Nile to Nineveh —

lg.l: Mountain and desert , wilderness and sea ,
Under and over , search — and find .

div.stage: Enter MICHAL joyously .

lg.l: O father , father ! David ! Listen !— Why ,
All here is dark and quivering as pain ,
And a foreboding binds me ere I breathe !
David , you have not been as sun to him !
Father , a secret ! Oh , and it will make
Dawn and delight in you !
Have heard ?— Why do you pale ?
Now are you Baal-bit ?
Michal !
MICHAL
David !… the dread .
What does it mean ? I cannot speak ! It shrinks
Shivering down upon my heart in awe !
So piteous are you ? suddenly so numb ?
And you are faint ? let it rush from your lips !
Can any moving in the world so bring
Terror upon you ! Speak , what is it ?
Ah !
I know not ; danger rising and its wing
Sudden against my lips !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: It shall not ! There — now again flows joy ; I think it flows .

lg.l: Yes , father , yes ! Have you
Not much desired discovery of whom
Samuel hath anointed ?
I ’ ve found
Almost have found ! A prophetess to-day
Hath told me that he is a —

div.stage: She stops in realizing horror .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Now you cease ? Sudden and senseless !

lg.l: God ! God !
Have I not bidden swiftly ! Ever then
Vexation ! I could — No . Will she not speak !

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Cannot ! Are you flesh of me !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: My lord , not anger ! Hear me …

lg.l: Hear !
Her lips could never seal upon a wrong .
Sudden divinity is on them , silence
Sent for the benison of Israel ,
Else were it shattered by her love to you !
Believe ! in all the riven realm of duty
There ’ s no obedience from thee she would hold .
If it seem other —

div.stage: Enter ABNER hurriedly .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I will not . Do you come with vexing too ?

sp.speaker: ABNER
sp.p: The Philistines — some fury is afoot . A spy within our gates — and scorns to speak .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Conspiracy of silence !… Back to him .

div.stage: ABNER goes .
To DAVID and MICHAL . ] But you — I ’ ll not forget . I ’ ll not forget .
SAUL goes .

lg.l: Forget ! anointing ! peril ! what are they all !
Michal ?— for me you have done this , for me ?
I am swung with joy , as palms of Abila !
A princess , you , and the veins of you live warm
With sympathy and love unto your father ,
Yet you have shielded me ?
I am — oh do not flint your loveliness !—
I am the anointed , but all innocent
In will or hope of any envious wrong
As lily blowing of blasphemy ! as dew
Upon it is of enmity !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Anointed ! You whom the king uplifted from the fields !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: And who am ever faithful to him !

lg.l: You ,
Whom Jonathan loves more than women love !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Yet reaches not my love to Jonathan !

lg.l: O Hear !
Of my anointing Jonathan is ’ ware ,
Knows it is holy , helpless , innocent
As dawn or a drift of dreaming in the night !
Knows it unsought — out of the skies — supernal —
From the inspirèd cruse of Samuel !
For Israel it dripped upon me , and
For Israel must drip until I die !
Or till high Gath and Askalon are blown
Dust on the wind , and all Philistia
Lie peopleless and still under the stars !—
Goliath , then , a laughter evermore !…
Still , still you shrink ! do you not see , not feel ?
So have you breathed yourself about my heart ,
Even as moon-lit incense , spirit flame
Burning away all barrier !
And all the world has streamed a rapture in ,
Till even now my lids from anger falter
And the dew falls !
Restrain ! O do not weep !
Upon my heart each tear were as a sea
Flooding it from all duty but the course
Of thy delight !
Poor , that I should have tears !
Fury were better , tempest ! O weak eyes ,
When ’ tis my father , and with Samuel
You creep to steal his kingdom !
Cruel ! fell accusal ! Yes ,
Utterly false and full of wounding !
Yet ,
Forgive that even when thy arrows drive
Deeper than all the skill of time can draw ,
I spare thee not the furrowed face of pain .…
Delirious wings of hope that fluttered up ,
At last to fall !

div.stage: Moves to go .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Peace to you — peace and joy !

div.stage: He turns . She sways , then reaches out her arms . As irresistibly they move toward each other , DOEG and MERAB appear through the curtains . MICHAL utters a low cry . They vanish .

lg.l: Yet what matter , now !
Were it the driven night-unshrouded dead !
Under the firmament is but one need ,
That you will understand !
But Merab ! ah ,
She ’ s cunning , cold and cruel , and she loves thee ;
Hath told her love to Ahinoam the queen !
And Doeg hates thee — since for me he ’ s mad !
Be it , his hate , as wild , as wide as winds
That gather up the desert for their blast ,
Be it as Sheol deep , stronger than stars
That fling fate on us , and I care not , care not ,
If I am trusted and to Michal truth !
Hear , hear me ! for the kingdom , tho ’ t may come ,
I yearn not , but for you !
For you !
Since I a shepherd o ’ er a wild of hills
First beheld you the daughter of the king
Amid his servants , leaning , still with noon ,
Beautiful under a tamarisk , until
All beauty else is dead —
Since then ,
I have been wonder ecstasy and dream !
The molded light and fragrant miracle ,
Body of you and soul , lifted me till
When you departed —
I
Fell thro ’ infinity of void !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Then came the prophet Samuel with anointing ! My hope sprung as the sun !

lg.l: Then was I called to play before the king .
Here in this hall where cherubim shine out ,
Where the night silence —
Strung me tense ,
I waited , shepherd-timid , and you came ,
You for the king to try my skill ! you , you !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Leave me , ah leave ! I yield !

lg.l: And often since
Have we not swayed and swept thro ’ happy hours ,
Far from the birth unto the bourne of bliss ?
To-night you did not to the king
Reveal my helpless chrism , give me to peril .
Say but the reason !
And shall I , shall I ? how this prophetess
Miriam hath foretold —

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Some wonder ? speak ! MICHALSpringing up the throne .Hath told I shall be queen of Israel !

lg.l: Michal , the queen ? the queen ! We two are then
Yoked of eternity unto this end !
MICHAL
No , no ! horror in me moans out against it !
Wed me with destiny against my father ?
Dethrone my mother ? Ah !
Then swear conspiracy upon its tide
Never shall lift you !
Deeper than soul or sea ,
Deep as divinity is deep , I swear .
If it shall come , the kingdom —
“ If !” not “ if .”
Surrender this anointing ! Spurn it , say
You never will be king though Israel
Kingless go mad for it !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: I cannot — and I must not . It is holy !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Then must I hate you — scorn you —

lg.l: But to reign over Israel you care ,
Not for the peace of it !
Thus all is vain ;
A seething on the lips , I ’ ll say no more …
Care but to reign and not for Israel ’ s calm ?
I who am wounded with her every wound ?…
Look out upon yon Philistine bold fires
Lapping the night with bloody tongue — look out !
As God has swung the world and hung forever
The infinite in awe , to-morrow night
Not one of them shall burn !
What is this strength ! It seizes on me ! No ,
I ’ ll not believe , no , no , more than I would
From a boy ’ s breath or the mere sling you wear
A multitude should flee ! And you shall learn
A daughter to a father may be true
Tho paleness be her doom until she die !

div.stage: She turns to go . Enter JONATHAN eagerly .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: My friend — my Jonathan ! ’ Tis you ?

div.stage: They embrace . MICHAL goes .

lg.l: Great heart , I ’ ve heard how yesterday before
The soldiers you .… But Michal gone ? No word ?
And disdains
Believing ? tell me .
No , not now — not now .
Let me forget it in a leap of deeds .
And all this murmur misty of distress ,
What is it ? sprung of the Philistines ? new terror ?
This sounding giant flings again his foam ?
Jonathan , I am flame that will not wait ,
What is it ? I must strike .
Tell me ,
And do not bring dissuasion more , or pause .
JONATHAN
With a spy who keeps
Fiercely to silence .
David , you must cool from this .
Determination surges you o ’ erfar .
I will not see you rush on perishing ,
Not though it be the aid of Israel .
I must .… I will not let them ever throng ,
Staining the hills , and starving us from peace .
Rather the last ray living in me , rather
Death and the desecration of the worm .
Bid me not back with love , nor plea ; I must !

div.stage: Enter SAUL with SAMUEL ; Soldiers with the spy ; AHINOAM with ABNER ; and all the court in suppressed dread .

lg.l: He will not speak , but scorns me , and his lips
Bitterly curve and grapple . But he shall
Learn there is torture to it ! Set him forth .
Tighten his bonds up till he moan .

div.stage: It is done .

lg.l: Accursed Philistine ! Now wilt thou tell
The plan and passion of thy people ’ gainst us ?

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Tighten the torture more .… Now will you ? SPYIn agony .

lg.l: SAUL
On , then , reveal .
New forces have arrived .
Numberless ; more than peaks of Arabah .
Unless before to-morrow ’ s moon one ’ s sent
To overthrow Goliath — Gods ! the pain !
Then Gibeah attacked , and all
Even to sucking babes be put to sword !

div.stage: A movement of horror .
She rushes frantically out .

lg.l: Then , Saul of Gibeah , one thing and one
Alone is to be done . A champion ,
To break this beetling giant down to death !

sp.speaker: SAMUEL
sp.p: Is none ! Call ! I order it .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Then who will dare against him !

div.stage: A silence .

lg.l: SAMUEL
You , Abner , will not ?

sp.speaker: SAMUEL
sp.p: Doeg , chief servant of the king ?

sp.speaker: DOEG
sp.p: Why me ? Had I a mother out of Israel ? I am an alien , an Edomite .

lg.l: My lord , this is no more endurable !
Futile and death ? Alien ? Edomite ?
Has not this Philistine before the gates
With insult and illimitable breath
Vaunting of vanity and smiting laughter
Boasted and braved and threatened up to Baal ?
And now unless one slay him , Israel
From babe to age must bleed and be no more !
I am a shepherd , have but seized the lion
And throttled the bleating kid out of his throat ;
Little it then beseems that I thrust in
Where battle captains pale and falter off ;
But this is past all carp of rank or station .
One must go out — Goliath must have end .
Sudden you hound about me ravenous ?
Have I thrown doom not daring to your feet ,
Ruler of Israel , that you rise wild ,
Livid above me as an avalanche ?
A plot ! it is a plot ! He will be slain —
From you , my lord , dominion then will fall !
Or should it not …
Liar ; it is no plot .
But courage sprung seraphic out of night ,
Beautiful and a bravery from God !
MICHAL
Open , and let me enter ! Open !

div.stage: She enters .

lg.l: It is not false ? but now , the uttermost ?
To-morrow , if Goliath still exult ,
There ’ s peril of desolation , bloody ruin ?
Then to your will ,
Father , unto will of yesterday
I bend me now with sacrificial joy .
Unto Goliath ’ s slayer is the hand
Of Michal , the king ’ s daughter !
DAVID
Michal ! Michal !

sp.speaker: DOEG
sp.p: See , see , my lord ! Do you not understand ?

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: It is another coiling of their plot !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Coiling of plot ? What mean you ?

lg.l: Ah ? You know
Not it is David offers against Goliath ?

div.stage: A low tumult is heard without . Enter a Captain hurriedly .

sp.speaker: CAPTAIN
sp.p: O King , bid me to speak !

lg.l: Fear is upon the host . There will
Be mutiny unless , Goliath slain ,
Courage spring up anew .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: My lord , then , choose ! Ere longer waiting fester to disaster .

lg.l: Yea , king of Gibeah , and bid him go ,
And Michal for his meed ! or evermore
Evil be on you and the sear of shame —
And haunting memory beyond the tomb !
Then let him — let him . And upon the field
Of Ephes-Dammin . But I am not blind !
Let him , to morrow ! Go , prepare the host .
Yet — I am king , remember ! I am king !

div.stage: SAUL goes ; there is a murmur of relief . All except MICHAL follow , with various expressions of joy or hate toward DAVID .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Michal !She looks at him ; struggles against tears , and turning , goes . DAVID stands gazing sadly after her . Then a trumpet sounds , and soldiers shouting exultantly without , throng to the porch .DAVIDThrilled ; his hand on his slingFor Israel ! For Israel !

div.stage: He goes , toward the soldiers .
CURTAIN .

div.head: ACT II

stage.stage: SCENE : The royal tent of Saul pitched on one hill of the battle-field of Ephes-Dammin . The tent is of black embroidered with various warlike designs . To one side on a dais are the chairs of SAUL and AHINOAM ; also DAVID ’ S harp . On the other side , toward the front , is a table with wine and wine cups . The tent wall is lifted along the back , revealing on the opposite hill , across a deep narrow valley , the routed camp of the Philistines : before it in gleaming brazen armor lies GOLIATH slain . Other hills beyond , and the sky above . By the wine table , her back to the battle-field , sits MERAB in cold anger . AHINOAM and several women look out in ecstasy toward DAVID , SAUL , JONATHAN and the army , returning victorious and shouting .

sp.speaker: THIRD WOMAN
sp.p: An avalanche . Over the brook and bright amid hosannas !

sp.speaker: FIRST WOMAN
sp.p: And the servants ! Goliath ’ s head high-borne upon a charger ! The rocks that cry reverberant and vast ! The people and the palms !

lg.l: Yea all the branches
Torn from the trees ! The waving of them — O !
And David , see ! triumphant , calm , between
The king and Jonathan !… His glory
All the wild generations of the wind
Ever shall utter ! Hear them —

div.stage: The tumult ascends afar

lg.l: A sea of shouting !—
O queen !

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: You yearn for it ? Then go and lave you in this tide of joy .

div.stage: The women go rapturously . AHINOAM turns .

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: I do not know , my child .

lg.l: Why did my father pledge her to him ! you
Not hindering !
She is your sister . You
Are pledged to Adriel .

sp.speaker: MERAB
sp.p: And as a slave ! And if I do not love him there is — riches ! If he is Sodom-bitter to me — riches !

lg.l: For my torture ! What
Kingdom is to a woman as her love !
Though he never
Sought me with any murmur or desire !
Though he is Michal ’ s for Goliath ’ s death !
Michal ’ s to-day , unless —

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: Merab , a care ! Too near in you were ever love and hate .

div.stage: The tumult nears . AHINOAM goes to look out .
DOEG enters to MERAB .

lg.l: A triumph o ’ er him , yet !
The king is worn , as a leopard pent , between
Wonder of David and quick jealousy
Because of praise this whelming of Goliath
Wakes in the people .
This .
I ’ ve skilfully disposed the women
To coldly sing of Saul , but of our David
With lavish of ecstasy as to a king .

div.stage: He watches her .

lg.l: As he
Was never — and shall never be again ,—

div.stage: He hands it to her . She dips the point of her dagger in it .

sp.speaker: MERAB
sp.p: As any fool ? Wait .— And the rest now , quick . This timbrel-player , Judith ?

lg.l: She is ready
And ravishing !
We will send her
Sudden , as Michal is alone with David ,
To seize him with insinuative kisses ,
And arms that wind as they were wonted to him .
Michal once jealous — and already I
Have sowed suspicions —
Will —? yes —?
DOEG
On him burst
And as a fury .

sp.speaker: MERAB
sp.p: May it be their rending !The tumult , near .Come , we must see .They go to look out . Shouts of “ David !” “ David !” arise , and a band of timbrel-players , dancing and singing , followed by a band of priests bearing the ark with its cherubim of gold , pass the tent opening . DAVID , SAUL , JONATHAN , ISHUI and the Court then enter amid acclamations ; before them servants , bearing the head of Goliath on a charger under a napkin . SAUL darkly mounts the throne with AHINOAM , to waving of palms and to praise .A WOMANbreaking from the throng .Our little ones are saved ! hosannah ! joy !

div.stage: She kisses DAVID ’ S hand .

lg.l: Woman , thy tongue should know an angel-word ,
Or seraph-syllables new-sung to God !
Earth has not any rapture well for this !
David , my brother !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Jonathan , my friend ! While life has any love , know mine for you .

lg.l: Then am I friended as no man was ever !
And though my soul were morning wide it were
Helpless to hold my wonder and delight !
O people , look upon him !
Never before in Israel rose beauty
Up to this glory !
Never !
Therefore I pour him splendor passionate .
In gold and purple , this my own , I clothe him .
David , my brother !
SAUL
SAUL
Thou full-of-lauding fool !
Of breath and ravishment unceasing !
Is it not praise enough , has he not reached
The skies on it !
Had Saul
Ever so rich a rapture from his son ?
Ever this worshipping of utterance ?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: My lord , my lord , this should not fret you . DOEGDerisively .

lg.l: DAVID
’ Tis only that the soul of Jonathan ,
Brimmed by the Philistines with bitterness ,
Sudden is joy and overfloweth —

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Upon his friend , thy servant , David .

div.stage: He turns away laughing .

lg.l: Why !
A WOMAN
King Saul has slain his thousands !
Do you hear ?
King Saul has slain his thousands , David ten !
Thy servant is he ? servant ?
DAVID
Shall thy sceptre
Be wielded by this venom-word , as is
A weed under the wind ?
’ Tis overmuch !
I ’ ll burst all bond of priest or prophecy .
Nor cringe to threatening and fondle fear .
I ’ ll smite where ’ er I will .
Shall
A rapid palsy now come on thy hand ,
Awful and sceptre-ruined lord of men ?
An impotence , a shriveling to fear ,
Avenging ere thou shed offenceless blood ?
Is this thy love , the love of Saul the king ?
Who once was kindlier than kindest are .
For but a woman ’ s wantonness of word
And idle air , my life ?
Some enemy — does Doeg curve his lip ?—
Hath put into her mouth this stratagem
Of fevered false-impassioned overpraise .
lg.stage: SAUL , silent , rises slowly and goes , entreated of JONATHAN . Many follow in doubt , whispering .
lg.l: DOEG
This is not all , boy out of Bethlehem .
Goliath ’ s dead —

div.stage: DOEG goes , flushing ,— and all follow , except MICHAL , and MERAB , who moves cunningly forward as if incensed .

lg.l: My father so ungenerously wroth !
And wrought away from recompense so right ;
Can you forgive him ?
Is it strange
That even I now ask it ?
Herself and not to-day your friend ; but now
Conquered to exaltation and aglow
To wreathe you for this might to Israel ,
Beautiful , unbelievable and bright !
Noble the dawn of it within your dream ,
Noble the lightning of it in your arm ,
And noble in your veins the fearless flow
And dare of blood !— so noble that I ask
As a remembrance and bequest forever ,
In priceless covenant of peace between us ,
A drop of it —
lg.stage: She draws her dagger and offers it to him .
lg.l: Upon this sacred blade .
Poor requital
To one whose greatness humbles me from hate .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Then of my veins whatever drop you will , Were it the very dwelling of my soul .He takes the dagger and makes as if to prick himself .Ah , but you do not mock me ?

lg.l: Rather upon
Its edge one vein of you — than priceless nard .
And perfume out of India jewel poured ?
Or than — I may believe ?— a miracle
Of dew , were you a traveller and lost
Upon the illimitable desert ’ s thirst ?
Or than —

div.stage: He draws his own dagger , pricks his wrist with it , and hands it to her .

sp.speaker: Shepherd !
sp.p: Treachery , then ? Under a sham of tribute , poison ?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: And I of vanity should prick it in ? I a mere shepherd innocent of wile ! A singer music-maudled and no more .As she goes , stung with chagrin .The daughter of king Saul has yet to learn .From looking after her , he turns toward MICHAL , and , sighing , slowly approaches her .The vaunting of this victory is done . We are alone at last .

lg.l: That is all ?
For Israel I ’ ve wrought to-day , for you
Who were about me , in me , as a mist
Of armed mighty angels triumphing .
To you no more ? to you
Whom not a slave can serve unhonored ?
MICHAL
DAVID
Empty of glow then seems it , impotent ,
A shrivelled hallowing .…
Ashes of ecstasy that burned in vain .
No , divine it was !
And had I cried my praise the ground had broke
To Eden under me with blossoming .
Where was so wonderful a deed as this ,
So fair a springing of salvation up !
Glory above star-soaring could I seize ,
Auras of dawn and loveliness unfading ,
To crown you with and crown !
With but
A sling , a shepherd ’ s sling , you sped the brook ,
Drew from its bed a stone , and up the hill
Where the great Philistine contemning cried ,
Mounted and flung it deep upon his brain !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: This is the victory and not his death ! Tell , tell thy joy with kisses on my lips ! Thy mouth ! thy arms ! thy breast !

lg.l: Thy soul !
Too much of waiting and of severance !
Of dread and distance and the deep of doubt .
Now must I fold you , falter all my love
And triumph on your senses till they burn
Beautiful to eternity with bliss .
A frenzy , ’ tis a frenzy ! From me ! see !
This irremediable victory
Over Goliath severs us the more .
Hear how the people lift you limitless !
Almost , to-day , and in my father ’ s room
They would that you were king .
But ere to-morrow
Dim shall I be , and ere the harvest bend
Less than a gleam in their forgotten peril !
O were it , were it ! But all silently
Jehovah fast is beckoning the realm
Into thy hands .
Then futile to resist
The gliding on of firm divinity .
And yet whatever may be shall be done .
Yet grant
It may be told my father ; that I may
Say to him all the secret !
And provoke
Murder in him , insatiable though
I fled upon the wilderness and famine ?

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: This stroke to-daypointing to GOLIATH ’ S headno love of me had in it .

lg.l: A love , a passion fervid thro ’ me as
The tread and tremble of immortal song
Along the infinite .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: A step to rise and riot in ambition !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: It was a trick ! You snared me to you .

lg.l: Cunningly
With Samuel netted fears about my father
Till I am paltrily unto you pledged .
No more ; the pledge I fling
Out of my heart , as ’ twere enchantment dead .
And free you ; but , no more .

div.stage: He moves from her .

lg.l: As if it were
Enchantment dead . Ah , then ’ tis true — there is
Another — is another !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Now what fever ? A gentleness clad once your every grace .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: There is some other that you lure and love .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: It is not Michal speaking ; so I wait .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Then —JUDITH glides suddenly in with a low laugh and kneels before DAVID . MICHAL stands amazed .JUDITHAs if with amorous admiration .Brave , it was brave , my love ! beauteous ! brave !

lg.l: The Philistine , a brazen tower ,
A bastion of strength fell to the earth !
Woman , who are you ?
Take away your flesh .
Take it away , the heat and myrrh of it .

sp.speaker: JUDITH
sp.p: And ’ tis no longer fair ?WantonlyOh ! Ah ! I understand ! the princess ?—

div.stage: JUDITH obeys , laughing and shaking her timbrel .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: A dancer then , a very timbrel player !

lg.l: Until this hour I never looked upon her .
It is chicanery of chance or craft .
You who are noble , though in doubt adrift ,
Be noble now !
And loving ? O , I will —
Now that I know what should be done . Be sure .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: You mean , that Saul ?— you would not , no !

div.stage: A hand is seen at the tent . AHINOAM enters .

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: David , the king — But what is this ?

div.stage: MICHAL goes .

lg.l: O queen —
It is but life .
Life that ever strings
Our hearts , so pitifully prone for it ,
To ecstasy — then snaps .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Then gracious be , and question here no more . Where words are futile for an utterance . But of the king — the king ?

lg.l: He ’ s driven still .
And hither comes , and soon , and must be calmed .
Thy harp take , winds of beauty from it bring ,
And consolation — as of valley-eves
When there is ebb of sorrow and of toil ,
O could you heal him and forever heal .

div.stage: He breaks off with a gesture of great desire , takes the harp and seats himself .

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: At once , for he will come .

div.stage: DAVID begins ; a strain of wild sadness . SAUL enters and with him DOEG , ISHUI , JONATHAN — others . He pauses , his hand to his brow , and goes slowly , enspelled of DAVID ’ s playing , up the dais .

sp.speaker: AHINOAM
sp.p: My lord , shall David sing — to ease us ?

lg.l: O heart of woe ,
Heart of unrest and broken as a reed !
O heart whose flow
Is anguish and all the bitterness of need !
O heart as a roe ,
Heart as a hind upon the mountain fleeing
The arrow-wounds of being ,
Be still , O heart , and rest and do not bleed !
O days of life ,
Days that are driven swift and wild from the womb !
O days so rife —
Days that are torn of trouble , trod of doom !
O days of strife ,
Days of desire on deserts spread unending ,
The burning blue o ’ erbending ,
O days , our peace , our victory is the tomb !
lg.stage: He plays to a close that dies in anguished silence .
lg.l: SAUL
SAUL
Thy breathing ! beauteous !
Stilling to sorrow ! O my friend , my son !
To me is this ? I dream it not ? The king
Again is kind and soft his spirit moves ?
How shelter o ’ er me then will spring
And safety covering !
It ever shall .
Loveliest have you been among my days ,
And singing weary madness from my brain .
How I have wronged thee !
No , but he
Is jeopardy and fate about you ! drive
Him from you utterly and now away !

div.stage: Murmurs of astonishment .

lg.l: But shall be ; for to tell
Would rend silence forever from you — pale
Your flesh with haunting of it evermore !
All , all your being would become a hiss .
A memory of syllables that sear ,
A living iteration of remorse .
I — I myself will save your lips the words
Of this betrayal leaping from your heart .
You seek , my lord , you seek whom Samuel
Anointed .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Then know that it is I .

lg.l: I . And guiltless I , no other .
I , though I sought it not and suffer , though
I would it had not come and fast am sworn
Never against you to lift up —

sp.speaker: MERAB
sp.p: Hear , hear ! Now he will cozen !

lg.l: Hear !
A VOICE
A thousand Saul hath slain ! But David ten !
SAUL
Omnipotence shall not withhold me more .

div.stage: He lifts a javelin .

lg.l: Murderous king afoam with murder-heat !
lg.stage: He avoids from side to side .
lg.l: Monarch of misery — of might — of rage
So fell that lightning were not dread enough
Were it thy bolt ! To-day you will destroy me ?
lg.stage: GOLIATH ’ S head overturned , rolls on the floor .
lg.l: Upon this day will slay me innocent ?
No , father , hold !
MICHAL
What have I done ?

div.stage: Thrusts a sword on him .

lg.l: He shall not ! no .
DAVID
Then , king of Israel , strike !
Strike me to darkness and the waiting worm !
Into the Pit and to the hopeless gloom .
But , after , be your every breathing blood ,
Remorse and riving bitterness and fear ,
Be guilt and all the hideous choke of horror !

div.stage: SAUL trembling at the curse lets the javelin fall from his hand . DAVID breaking through DOEG and ISHUI escapes by the door . MICHAL sinks to her knees , her face buried in her hands .
CURTAIN .

div.head: ACT III .

stage.stage: SCENE : A savage mountain-cliff in the wilderness of Engeddi . On either side gray crags rise rugged , sinking away precipitously across the back . Cut into each is a cave . The height is reached by clefts from all sides .

Between the crags to the East is the far blue of the Dead Sea ; and still beyond , bathed in the waning afternoon , stretch the purple shores of Moab . During the act the scene grows crimson with sunset and a thunder-cloud rises over the sea .

Lying on a pallet of skins near the cliff ’ s verge , DAVID tosses feverishly . Three of his followers and a lad , who serves him , are gathered toward the front , ragged , hungry , and hunted , in altercation over a barley-cake .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Water ! the fever fills me , and I thirst . Water !

lg.l: DAVID
Water ! I thirst .
Yes , yes , my lord .
Ah , empty , not a quaff !
They ’ ve drunk it all from him ! My lord , none ’ s left .
I ’ ll run and in the valley brim it soon .
SECOND FOLLOWER
You drank it then .
And should I thirst , not he ?
Give me the bread .
SECOND FOLLOWER
If it would strangle you .
I ’ ll have it .
SECOND FOLLOWER
Or betray him ? spitingly ?
It is the last . Already you have eat .
And we are here within a wilderness .

sp.speaker: FIRST FOLLOWER
sp.p: Be it , but I ’ ll not starve .

lg.l: He utters right .
Why should we but to follow a mere shepherd
Famish and o ’ er a hundred desert hills ?
The prophecy portending him the throne —
Folly , not fate ! though it is Samuel ’ s .
I ’ ll trust in it no more .
And Saul
Has driven us from waste to waste — pressed us
Even unto the Philistines for shelter ,
And now unto this crag . And is not David ’ s
Thought but of Michal , not of smiting him
And , with a host , of leaping to the kingdom ?

div.stage: DAVID stirs to rise .

lg.l: THIRD FOLLOWER
And fawning too ?
DAVID
Men — men , we must have news .
Perpetual ,
Implacable they stare unto each other .
This rock and stony sky .
lg.stage: Rises and comes down to them .
lg.l: We must have news .
Longer is death . ’ Tis overmany days
Of sighing and remembered verdancy ;
Nor any dew or upward odor comes .
Who will go now and bring us word of Saul ?
Have not Abishai , Abiathar ,
And others gone ?
Well , then , we are not swine ,
And life ’ s but once .
We will follow you
No longer hungered and rewarded never ,
But perilously ever .
It is well .
lg.stage: He looses a bracelet from his arm .
lg.l: This was a gift from Saul . In it is ease .
lg.stage: Gives it to THIRD FOLLOWER , who goes .
lg.l: This ring was Jonathan ’ s . The jewel tells
Still of the sunny haven of his heart .
Upon my hand he pressed it — the day we leapt
Deeper than friends into each other ’ s love .

div.stage: Gives it to FIRST FOLLOWER , who goes .

lg.l: DAVID
You have not thought ;
’ Tis riches — such as Sidon marts and Tyre
Would covet .
SECOND FOLLOWER
DAVID
None else is left .
SECOND FOLLOWER
SECOND FOLLOWER
There was of Gibeah
A woman — dear to me . Her face at night
Weeping among my dreams .…
The prophecy
Is unfulfilled , and vain !
And you would go ?
SECOND FOLLOWER
The suffering — this cliff .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: I understand ,Motions .So , without any blame , and to content .The SECOND FOLLOWER falters , then goes .Quietly .A desolation left , of rock and air , Of barren sea and bitterness as vast . Thou hast bereft me , Saul ! thou hast bereft !He moves up the cliff , gazes sadly away , then kneels by a stone , as to pray .My flesh cries for oblivion — to sink Unwaking away into the Night … where is No tears , but only tides of sleep .… No , crieth Not for Oblivion and Night , but for Rage and revenge ! Saul ! Saul !… My spirit , peace . As pants the heart for the water-brook , so I !He bows his head . MICHAL in rags that disguise , enters with the LAD , unseen .Her lips it was that hurled me unto this ! Yet , yet not violence on him and blood ! I must revenge ’ s call within me quell , Though righteously it quivers and aflame .

div.stage: He goes slowly into the cave , Right .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: This is the place , then , this ?

lg.l: Here
So long in want and sickness he hath hid ?
Under the livid day and lonelier night !
Little lad !
But he has heard no word from me — not how
My father , Saul , frantic of my repentance ,
Had unto Phalti , a new lord , betrothed me ?
How then I fled to win unto these wilds ?
He heard not anything — only the tales
I told of Moab , my own land .

div.stage: DAVID plays within .

lg.l: And strains that weep o ’ er me !…
I ’ ll speak to him … and yet must be unknown !
A leper ? as a leper could I …?
Why
Must he not know you ?
Ask me not , lad , now ;
But go a little .
Yes .
lg.stage: He sets down the water-skin and goes .
lg.l: MICHAL
lg.stage: Delaying , then in a loud voice .
lg.l: Unclean ! Unclean !

div.stage: Conceals her face in her hair .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Unclean ! DAVIDAppearing .Who cries unclean ? Poor leper in these wilds , who art thou ?

lg.l: One
Outcast and faint , forlorn !
Then you have come
To one more bitter outcast than yourself ,
One who has less than this lone void to give ,
This sterile solitude and sun , this scene
Of leaden desolation that makes mad .
Who has no ease but cave or shading rock ,
Or the still moon , or stars that glide the night .
One over whom ——
The pale hours
Flow dead into eternity .
My cloak , then , for thy tattered limbs . Or , no —
This chain of Ophir for thy every need .
Once was it dear , but should be so no more .
Have it , and with it vanish memory
Out of my breast ——
And from me fall
Link upon link her loveliness that bound .
Nothing . A chain like this
I once beheld wind undulantly bright
O ’ er Michal , the king ’ s daughter .
A spy ?
A spy of Saul and hypocrite have crept
Hither to learn …?
How then
Wandering come you here ?
My brain is overfull of fever , mad .
Almost and I had touched thy peril , held
Thy hideous contagion .
Then who
Art thou to know and speak of her , of Michal ?

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: One who has served the king .

lg.l: And you have seen
Michal , you have beheld her ?
Once , when she
In face was fairer and in heart than now
They say she is .
A night
Under the leaves of Gibeah — when she
Sang with another — David .
And from afar , under the moon , blew faint
The treading of the wine-presses with song .
David she loved , but anger-torn betrayed ,
Unworthy of him .
Speak of her no more ,
Nor of her cruelty , unless to pray
He she has ruined may forget her .
Yet
If deep she should repent ——?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Leper , no more .A moment ; then a jackal ’ s cry shrills to them . DAVID starts .The signal .He listens .Thrice repeated ? Word at last ?To MICHAL .He who is near may prove to thee less kind .She goes . He springs to look down the cliff .Abishai ? Abiathar ? It is ! But staggering and wounded ? breathless ? torn ?He watches , then turns to meet them . They enter — ABIATHAR with bloody ephod and broken breastplate — and sink in panting exhaustion .Abishai , what is it that you bring ? Abiathar , up ! answer !

lg.l: Up !
lg.stage: He brings the water-skin . They drain it fiercely .
lg.l: What is it now so fevered from you stares
And breathing too abhorrence ? Gasp it out .
I stifle — in a universe — he still —
Has breath in .
I ’ ll scathe him ! Scorpions
Of terror and remorse sting in his soul !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: If you have tidings , not in words so wild .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Then ask and hate shall calm me .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: On , on ! Seek if he lives !

lg.l: Seek if prophecy
Founts yet in Judah !
Is dead !…
Dead — and of tidings more calamitous .
DAVID
Tell on . I hear .
Saul gloating to believe
The priests , assembled sacredly at Nob ,
Plotted assisting you , hath had them ——

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Slain at the hands of Doeg — murdered , all !

lg.l: Was among them ; fell .
DAVID
Abiathar , my friend !… Appeaseless Saul !
Hear all , hear all ! Thy father , too , and mother ,
Even thy kindred , out of Israel
Are driven into Moab ; and this king ,
Delirious still for blood as desert pard ,
With Merab , whelp of him , and many armed ,
Is near us now — aquiver at Engeddi
For your destruction :
And yet you will not strike .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Low .No , but of Michal , tell me good at once , Lest unendurable this lot , I may — and mount o ’ er every oath into revenge .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: She withholds her father ’ s wrath ?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Not if you say no more .

lg.l: I know
Nothing of her .
Perhaps :
As did her love .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Well , what ? A woman who betrays ?

lg.l: Speak , not evade ;
And judge her when earth has no mystery .
Then from your craving put her — wide ; she is
Unworthy any tremor of your veins .
Dawn-lilies under dew are then unworthy ,
And nesting doves are horrible to heaven .
I will not so believe . Your reason …!
Saul
Has given her — and she will wed him , aye —
To Phalti , a new lord .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Cry . Yet you will believe it .

lg.l: Not until
The verdant parable of spring is hushed
Ever of bloom , to prove it . Never till
Hermon is swung into the sea ! until
The last void of the everlasting sky ——

div.stage: Looking up he falters , breaks off , and is strangely moved at something beheld .
DAVID points . They look up .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Falling here . And beating against death unbuoyantly .The bird , an arrow through it , drops in throes at their feet .A destiny , a fate in this is hidden !

div.stage: He bends over it , then quickly back .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: The arrow !— His ! His , and no other ’ s . Quick , then , no delay .

lg.l: We are discovered — near
On us is death . Open the secret chamber
Within the cave , for from the bow of Saul
Is yonder bleeding — from no other .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Saul ’ s ? But how , was any here ?

div.stage: ABISHAI with the water-skin hastens into the cave , Right . DAVID and ABIATHAR stand listening . Noise of approach is heard .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Almost I am beyond this tolerance .

lg.l: In truth . Therefore it is you rise and shake
Out of his power the sceptre !
Tempt me not !
Mercy and memory almost are dead ,
And craving birth in me is fateful ire .

div.stage: They follow into the cave . Hardly have they done so when at a shout , SAUL , bloodthirsty , with DOEG , ABNER , ISHUI , and soldiers , pour in from all sides , with drawn weapons .

lg.l: On , to him ! search the caves ! In , in , and bring
Him to my sword , and Michal with him .
They
Shall couch upon eternity and dust .
I am the king , and Israel is mine .…
I ’ ll sleep upon their grave — I ’ ll sleep upon it ,
And hear the worm …!
lg.stage: To a SOLDIER re-entering from one cave .
lg.l: Where is he ? Bring him .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: You ’ ve slain him and you tremble ! Say it .

lg.l: A treachery ! You cunningly contrive
To aid him , so .…
lg.stage: To a SOLDIER re-entering fearfully from the other cave .
lg.l: Bring me his head .
My lord ,
He is not there .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I tell you it is lies — Because you deem that he shall be the king And treasure up reward and amnesty .Into one cave , then another he rushes , then out among them furious .From me , ill-fruited ineffectual herd ! Away from me , he ’ s fled and none of you Is servant and will find and for me seize him ! From me — I ’ ll sleep — I ’ ll rest — and then —

div.stage: All begin to crowd out , overawed , but DOEG and ABNER .

p.stage: Slowly he moves into the cave , Left , and lies down .

lg.l: Yes ; is on him swift
As never before , and as a drunkenness .

sp.speaker: ABNER
sp.p: And Merab , too , will soon be here .

lg.l: I ’ ll go and look upon him .
lg.stage: Goes to SAUL ’ S cave and returns .
lg.l: Already he sleeps .
lg.stage: Turning they encounter MICHAL entering , still disguised . She quails .
lg.l: Woman , who are you , who ?
Unclean ? a leper ? in this place ? Are there
No stones to stone you ? Hence ! And had I not
A brother such as thou ——

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Pity ! Unclean !She goes quickly ; then they . A space . Then she returns trembling , fearful .I ’ ll call him ! I will save him !— David ! David !— I his discomfiture and ruin !— David ! David ! hear me ! David !Searching , she approaches the cave where SAUL lies , but recoils terrified .The king ! my father ! I cannot — am not — whither shall I , whither ?

div.stage: Confused she flees , as scuffling is heard , and ABISHAI and ABIATHAR , struggling with DAVID , appear .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Loose me , I say . ’ Twas Michal and she called .Breaking free .I say that it was she !

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Foolhardy , no . Return into the cave , and ere too late !

div.stage: MERAB , veiled , enters behind them .

lg.l: The breathing of archangels could not so
Have swung the burden from me as her call .

div.stage: Searching , he faces — and beholds MERAB . His look grows to coldness .
He motions ABIATHAR and ABISHAI aside .

lg.l: Need not lift her veil
Or longer stay . The path she came is open .
I ’ m here — and here will speak ! I ’ ve hither stolen ,
Yearning — I say it — yearning — and I will .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: These words I do not know .

lg.l: Because you will not .
More all-devouring than a Moloch is
This love within me ——
Love and you are twain ,
As sun and Sheol .
False . I am become
For want of you as famine-wind , a wave
In the mid-tempest , with no rest , no shore .
I do not hear the unashamed words
Of one who has but recently another ,
Adriel , wedded .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: I beg you but to cease .

lg.l: Goaded , chagrined ?
No , but this will I do . The Philistines ,
For long at rioting within their walls ,
Gather again and break toward Gilboa .…
To-morrow must my father
From hunting you return and arm for battle .
But — many would that you were king .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: I do not understand your eyes .

lg.l: I will
For love of you arouse rebellion up ,
Murmur about the host your heaven-call ,
And lift you to the kingdom .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: To the — stay ! Your words again .

sp.speaker: MERAB
sp.p: What is your mien ? you will not ?

lg.l: Twice the words —
Full from her lips — and to betray her father .

div.stage: ABIATHAR discovers SAUL .

lg.l: Odious utterly !
As yonder sea of death and bitter salt ,
As foam-girt Joppa of idolatry ,
As Memphian fane of all abhorrencies !
Morning would move with horror of it , noon
A livid sepulchre of shame span o ’ er ,
And night shrink to remember day had been !
Then Saul shall rend you dead . And Jonathan !…
Perchance you have not heard that Jonathan
Knows to the Philistines you fled — and loathes you !
Nor have not , ah ? how Michal
Is given to the embraces of another ?
You desperately breathe and pale at last ?
To me for aid , to me , you yet shall come .

div.stage: She goes . DAVID slowly lifts his hand to his brow in heavy pain . ABIATHAR — and soon ABISHAI — abruptly descends from the cave to him .

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Not till you know — and strike !

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: I tell you ’ tis the king .

lg.l: Who lieth yonder ,
And sleeping lieth — for a thrust to end .
This throb and wounds that wring me ! and this wail
Under the deeps of me against his wrongs ,
Awakening remembrance that with burst
And burn of pain .… O , never-ceasing ill !

div.stage: Flings the sword down , anguished .

lg.l: Has Saul
Hunted you to this desert ’ s verge ——?

sp.speaker: ABIATHAR
sp.p: Has he pursued you , all his hate unleashed ? Is Samuel not slain ? the priests ? my father ? The kingdom is not in decay , and falls ? You are not prophecy ’ s anointed one ? Seize up the sword and strike — or I myself !

div.stage: Silently he puts them aside , takes up the sword , and slowly goes into SAUL ’ S cave .
MICHAL enters unseen .

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: To them .What is this !DAVID , haggard , with drawn sword and a piece of SAUL ’ S cloak in his hand , re-enters from the cave . He sees MICHAL , pauses , and gazes upon her , as she on him , with rising emotion .MICHALInarticulate . Then .Ah , you have slain — Have slain him ! Wretch ! thou wretch ! And sleeping as he was !

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Then it was you ? In lying rags ?

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Have struck him in his sleep ! And merciless !— And now will kill me , too ?

lg.l: In faithless rags ? You are the leper ? Who
Drove me a prey unto this wilderness !
Upon the blot of it and death and sear !
The silence , burning , and relentless swoon !
You are the leper , who have broken troth
And shut the cry of justice from your breast !
Who ’ ve stifled me with desolation ’ s woe ,
Who ’ ve followed still and still have me betrayed !
Slain thy father ? slain ?
lg.stage: Flinging the piece of SAUL ’ S cloak at her feet .
lg.l: See how I might — see , see you , yonder he lies
A king who quits the kingdom , though a cloud
Of Philistines is foaming toward Gilboa ;
Jeoparded leaves it , undefended , for
Pursuit of me and pitiless harrying !
A king who murders priests .…
Stifles God
With penitence that he has shaped the world !
Have slain ? have slain him ! I have slain him ! Ah !
Ah , that I had thy falseness and could slay him !
Nevermore near me ! never with
That quivering and tenderness of lure .
Those eyes that hold infinity of fate ,
That breathing cassia-sweet , but sorcery !
Never thy presence pouring beauty , swift ,
And seething in the brain as frantic wine !
I ’ ll be no more enspelled of thee — never !
I will not hear thee and be wound by words
Into thy wile as wide as Ashtoreth ’ s ,
Back into hope , eternity of pain !

div.stage: In agony he goes , ABIATHAR and ABISHAI after . MICHAL stands gazing fearlessly before her , as SAUL , awakened , slowly comes from the mouth of the cave down toward her .
CURTAIN .

div.head: ACT IV .

stage.stage: SCENE : The House of MIRIAM , the “ Witch of Endor ,” by Mount Gilboa — where Saul is encamped against the Philistines . It is of one story , built rectangularly about an inner court , which is dimly lighted .

Under the gallery which ranges around the court are doors leading to the sleeping and other apartments ; before one of these , a lattice . On the left is the gate opening to the street . In the back to one side , the teraphim , or image of divination ; on the other side a stairway mounts to the roof . Above is the night , and vague lightning amid a moan of wind . During the act comes dawn .
Forward on a divan sits MIRIAM alone , in blind restlessness .

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: Adah ! The child is sunken in a sleep . Yet would I have her near me in this night , And hear again the boding of her tale . Unto the blind the vision and the awe Of the invisible sway ever in , The shadow of nativities that lead Upon fatality . Girl ! Adah ! girl !The wind passes . ADAH enters from a chamber , rubbing her eyes .Thou art awake ?

lg.l: Stand you where
Fathoming I may feel within you . Now ,
Again — you ’ ve hither fled your mistress Merab ,
In fear of her ?
At Engeddi Michal
By Saul was apprehended ? Merab now
Plotteth against her — she and Doeg ?
And ’ twas in Merab ’ s tent you heard , the king
Despairing of to-morrow ’ s battle , comes
Hither to-night to bid me lift the spirit
Of Samuel out of the dead and learn
The issue ?
And — you hear ?—
Many within the army urge for David ,
Would cry him king , if Saul were slain ?

div.stage: A knock at the gate . They start up fearful .

lg.l: Who seeks blind Miriam of Endor ’ s roof ,
Under the night and unextinguished storm ?
Come you a friend ?
DAVID
A friend .

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: As knows my soul !Breathless she opens the gate . DAVID and ABIATHAR enter cloaked .Thy voice again !— this blindness of my eyes — If it be David , speak .

lg.l: David of Jesse , Israel ’ s desire !
Let me behold thee
with my fingers ’ sight ,
And gather in them touch of thee again !
Thy voice is as dream-dulcimers that stir
Quivering myrrh of memory and joy —
But , aie ! why are you here ? You have been there ?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Yes — in the camp of Saul .

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: In spite of death ! Do you not know ——?

lg.l: I know — that Saul would rather
O ’ ertrample me than a multitude of foes .
That it is told him I who shun his ire —
Though death were easier , if dutiful —
Am come up with the Philistines to win
The kingdom . That he would slay me though I fought
For Israel !— But , Michal !——

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: What brews ? She was not in the camp .

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: Men all are mad ! And you who should be never .

lg.l: She is in
Some peril .
You , in more ! And must from here
Swiftly away , for Saul is ——

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: You are the anointed !A heavy knock at the gate .Ah , calamity ! You would not heed —’ tis Saul !

lg.l: He is come
That I shall call up Samuel .
You , you —
The awful dead ?
Woman of Endor ! woman !
lg.stage: DAVID and ABIATHAR conceal themselves behind the lattice . The knocking , hastier .
lg.l: Woman of Endor ! Woman of Endor ! Woman !
To rueing if
You tarry !

div.stage: She opens the gate . ADAH cowers down . SAUL , ISHUI , and ADRIEL enter .

lg.l: Witch of Endor , you ,
Who of the fate-revealing dead divine .
Out of the Pit you call them !

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: I say that you can lift them !

lg.l: You are come
With snaring ! knowing well that Saul the king
Is woe and bitterness to all who move
With incantation .
I must have up out of the Awfulness
Him I would question .
Prepare
Before thy teraphim . No harm , I swear ,
Shall come of it . Bid Samuel appear .
The battle ! its event !

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: With a cry .I know thee now ! Saul ! thou art Saul ! the Terror !

lg.l: Call him up .
Ready is it , the battle — but I am
Forsaken of all prophecy and dream ,
Of voices and of priest and oracle ,
To augur it .
He must
Hold comfort , and the torrent of despair
Within me stay and hush .

sp.speaker: MIRIAM
sp.p: Then must it be .Turning towards the teraphim amid wind and pallid lightning , and prostrating herself before it .Prophet of Israel , who art beyond The troubling and the terrifying grave , Th ’ immeasurable moan and melancholy Of ways that win to Sheol — Rise ! Arise !She waits . Only the gust . Then springing up and stretching wide her arms with wild , blind eyes .Prophet of Israel , arise ! Not in The name of Baal , Amon , Ashtoreth , Dagon or all the deities that dream In trembling temples of Idolatry , But of Jehovah ! of Jehovah ! rise !

div.stage: An elemental cry is heard . Then vast wavering forms rise out of the earth , in continuous stream . MIRIAM , with a long curdling shriek , sinks moaning to her knees .

sp.speaker: SAUL
sp.p: Woman , I cannot — dare not — look upon it . Utter thy sight .

div.stage: The spirit of SAMUEL begins to take shape through the phantoms .

lg.l: I saw ascending
Forms as of gods in swaying ghostliness ,
Dim apparitions of a dismal might ,
And now is one within a mantle clad ,
Who looketh ——
Who looketh with
Omniscience in his mien , and all the chill
And cling about him of eternity .
His eyes impale me !

div.stage: He falls heavily to the ground .

lg.l: O evil king ! and wretched king ! why hast
Thou brought me from the quietness and rest .
Evil thou art
For underneath this night thou hast conspired
Death to thy daughter Michal — if at dawn
The battle shall be lost — lest she may fall
Into the hands of David ——
DAVID
O !

sp.speaker: SAMUEL
sp.p: I tell thee , Saul , thy sceptre shrivels fast . The battle shall be lost — it shall be lost .

div.stage: The spirit of SAMUEL disappears . A wail of wind .

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: Ishui , true ? Is Michal to be slain ?

sp.speaker: ISHUI
sp.p: This is no hour for fools and questioning .

lg.l: The battle , Ishui , at once command
It shall begin ! To Jonathan and say it .
No prophecy shall sink me and no shade .
I am the king , and Israel , my own .

div.stage: Frenzied he goes . A silence .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Breaking forth .Michal to die and Israel to fall ! Prophet of prophets , Samuel , return !

div.stage: ADRIEL goes .

lg.l: Quicksands of destiny beneath her stir .
Is heaven a mocking shield which ever keeps
God from our prayers ?

div.stage: A faint uproar begins afar ; and dawn .

lg.l: The battle ! on the wind . Abiathar ,
Speed out upon the mountain-side and cull
All that befalls .

div.stage: ADAH opens the gate . ABIATHAR goes .

lg.l: I saw her — she
Is coming hither ! Do not let her — she
I fear — I fear her !

div.stage: MERAB throws open the gate and enters .

lg.l: Woman and witch , did Adriel , my husband ,
Come to you with the king ?

div.stage: She sees DAVID and shrinks .

lg.l: Unnatural ,
Unkind , most cruel sister !
Once me you would have poisoned , but the coil
Within your bosom I beheld . And now
Michal your sister is the victim .
I —
Know not your meaning .
The battle burning yonder ,
If it adversely veers , the king has planned
Michal is not to live , lest she may hap
Unto my arms .

div.stage: The tumult again .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Almighty , smite , and save to thee thy people ! And save thy altars unto Israel .

div.stage: He bows his head . A stir comes at the gate .
DAVID throws a cloak over his face . ADAH obeys . ADRIEL enters , and DOEG , who pauses in quick alarm , as DAVID goes between him and the gate .

sp.speaker: DOEG
sp.p: What place is this ? Why do you bar that gate ? Merab , ’ tis you ? Why do you gaze , rigid ? And this is the blind witch , Miriam ?

div.stage: He throws off his cloak .

sp.speaker: DOEG
sp.p: Lured ? I am snared ? a trap ?

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: If she is an atom harmed ——! Where is she ?

lg.l: I was the servant of the king ,
I but obeyed him .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: And thy horrible heart . Then speak , or unto frenzy I am driven .

sp.speaker: DOEG
sp.p: I ’ ll drive you there with ——

div.stage: Breaks off with low laugh .

lg.l: Unto your
Soft sympathy — and passion ?
She is dead .
If it is so , the lightning , that is wrath
Within the veins of God , should sink its fang
Into thy bosom and sear out thy heart .
If it is so , this momentary calm ,
This silence pouring overfull the world ,
Would rush and in thee cry until thy bones
Broken of guilt are crumbled in thy groans .
Dead , she is dead ?
No , David , my lord , he lies !
To wound you , lies !
I see her eyes !
I see her in a vision . She is near —
Is in a cave — is bound — and is alone .
I will go to her — quickly bring her .
Not
If this shall reach you .
Ah , to pierce a woman !
You ’ ve plotted , false have been and bloody , foul ,
And as a pestilence of midnight marsh
Have oozed corruption into all around you .
The kingdom thro ’ you is in brokenness ,
Within its arteries you flow , poison ,
Incentive of irruption and unrest ,
Of treachery and disaffection ’ s sore ,
Till even the stars of truest ray seem tares
Sown hostile o ’ er the nightly vale of heaven .

div.stage: Drawing firmly , he coldly , skilfully approaches for attack .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: Unto the end !He rushes in , they engage . DOEG is wounded , recovers , defends furiously , then is disarmed and forced under .Thy villainy is done .

div.stage: The gate opens and ABIATHAR hurries in .
He sees DOEG and stops .

lg.l: Only fetter ?
The murderer
Of priestly sanctity and of my father ?
Abiathar ! You know obedience ?
lg.stage: ABIATHAR sullenly sheathes his weapon and binds DOEG . A dim panic is heard afar , and a lament without . DAVID , who has sunk to a seat , springs anxiously up .
lg.l: Listen ! that cry !
Then
Off with his armor for me , I will go
Forth and perchance may backward bend defeat .
Duty to Saul is over .

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: You must not . A fruitless intrepidity it were .

div.stage: MIRIAM enters leading MICHAL . A moment ’ s suspense .

lg.l: David ——
MICHAL
MIRIAM
The cords were cruel , hungrily sank in
Her wrists and ankles .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: My words must be alone with her — alone .

sp.speaker: ADRIEL
sp.p: Come , all of you — the battle .

div.stage: They go out the gate . DAVID stands speechless .

lg.l: David — my lord !
I ask not anything but to be heard —
Though once I would not hear . Has all of life
No glow for me !
I was a woman — the entanglement
Of duty amid love we have no skill
To loosen , but with passion .
You too late
Remember it is so .
Nobility
All unbelievable it seemed that you
Could innocently watt on time to tide
You to the kingdom . Then forgive , I plead .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: But in the wilderness , your perfidy !

lg.l: Doubt of it welleth thro ’ your voice . No , no ,
To save you strove I ——!
Not to betray !
From Saul , my father , penitent I fled ,
Seeking you in Engeddi ’ s wild .
This knife
Unfailingly into my breast had spared
Me from him , had not flight .
This — this can be ?
lg.stage: A great joy dawning in him .
lg.l: Beyond all hope is it , even as day ’ s
Wide empery outspans our littleness .
A tithing of thy loveliness were beauty
Enough for earth . Yet it is mine , is mine ?
David — forever ! long as odorous
Cooling o ’ er Lebanon shall blow , long as
The swinging sapphire of the sea shall flash
Up to the sun : until the soul no more
Is soul , but vapor !

sp.speaker: MICHAL
sp.p: Evermore !She sinks into his arms , and there is a pause . But a sudden confusion of cries is heard and they start apart . The gate is flung back and ADRIEL enters , shaken with awe . He looks from one to the other , silent .DAVIDAt last .Adriel ! What have you !

lg.l: Fell beside him down .
The fray was fast — Israel fled — the foe
Fierce after Saul , whom Jonathan defended .

sp.speaker: DAVID
sp.p: And my brother Jonathan ! If I believe it will not miracle Alone bring joy again unto my pain ?The wailing again without , and deeper groans .O Israel , the Infinite has touched Thy glory and it changes to a shroud ! Thy splendor is as vintage overspilt . For Saul upon the mountains low is lying , And Jonathan beside him , beautiful Beyond the mar of battle , and of death .He bows his head in tears .O kingly Jonathan , would I might give The beating of my life into your veins — Willing for it would I be drouth and die . How are the mighty fallen and the fair !With lifted arm , deeply moved .Peaks , mountains of Gilboa , let no more Dew be upon you , and as sackcloth let Clouds cover you , and ashes be your soil , Until I bring upon Philistia And Gath and Askalon extinguishing , And sorrow — and immensity of tears !MICHAL goes to him and takes his hand . He folds her in his arms .But we must calm the flowing of this grief . Though yet we cannot mind us to remember Love will as sandal-breath and trickling balm O ’ erheal us in the unbegotten years , Too headlong must not be our agony . Hush now thy woundedness , my Michal , now . See , o ’ er the East the lifted wings of dawn .

div.stage: Slowly they climb the stair to the house-top . At they look away toward the battle ’ s rout the clouds part , and the full brightness of the sun breaks over them .
CURTAIN .
